result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Doyle

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew Doyle appeared by video.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo appeared by video for Andrew Doyle.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Lugo was just appointed to the case and needs discovery and an offer.  Case is adjourned to 11-7-22 at 8:30 am for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JAW.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Andrew Doyle in court. Student Intern Madeline Whitty under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 10 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew Doyle
Current: 1017 W Maple St., Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 08-09-2022)
Prior: 2034 South 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Defendant posted cash bail.  Ordered in on 9/23/22 @ 1p in Safety Building room 221
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
